description: A savory and satisfying fried rice dish where diced ham is stir-fried with rice, vegetables, and aromatic seasonings. The salty, smoky flavor of the ham infuses the rice, while the colorful vegetables add freshness and crunch. This quick one-pan meal is perfect for using leftover rice and makes an excellent weeknight dinner or special breakfast.

cultural_significance.cultural_notes: Ham fried rice represents the growing diversity of protein options in urban Ugandan cuisine. While ham is not traditionally Ugandan, it has become increasingly available in urban supermarkets and is enjoyed by both locals and expatriates. This dish is particularly popular in households that enjoy experimenting with international ingredients while maintaining the familiar comfort of fried rice. It's often prepared for quick meals and is especially favored by those who enjoy the convenience of pre-cooked ham.

ingredients.name: Cooked White Rice (preferably day-old)
ingredients.notes: Cold rice works best for fried rice

ingredients.name: Cooked Ham, diced
ingredients.notes: Can use leftover holiday ham or store-bought cooked ham

ingredients.name: Frozen Peas and Carrots Mix
ingredients.notes: Thawed, or use fresh diced carrots and peas

ingredients.name: Salt
ingredients.notes: Use sparingly as ham and soy sauce are already salty

steps.instruction: Break up the cold cooked rice with your fingers to separate the grains and prevent clumping during frying.
Dice the cooked ham into small, bite-sized cubes.
Beat the eggs in a small bowl with a pinch of white pepper.
Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a large wok or frying pan over medium-high heat.
Pour in the beaten eggs and scramble until cooked through but still soft. Remove from the pan and set aside.
Add another tablespoon of oil to the same pan. Add the diced ham and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until lightly browned and fragrant. Remove and set aside with the eggs.
Add the remaining tablespoon of oil to the pan. Add chopped onion and saut√© for 2 minutes until translucent.
Add minced garlic and cook for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add the peas and carrots mix (and corn if using). Stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until the vegetables are heated through and tender.
Add the cooked rice to the pan. Stir well to combine with the vegetables.
Pour soy sauce and oyster sauce evenly over the rice. Add white pepper and salt (if using). Stir-fry for 2 minutes until everything is well combined.
Add the cooked ham and scrambled eggs back into the pan. Stir gently to distribute evenly.
Continue stir-frying for 1-2 minutes until everything is heated through and the rice has a slightly crispy texture.

cooking_indicators.visual: Rice should be steaming hot with some crispy bits
cooking_indicators.olfactory: Savory, smoky ham aroma will develop

steps.instruction: Drizzle with sesame oil and stir in most of the chopped green onions, reserving some for garnish.
Taste and adjust seasoning if needed. Be careful with salt as ham is already salty.
Serve hot, garnished with the remaining green onions.

serving_suggestions: Serve as a complete meal on its own or with a simple side salad. Excellent for breakfast, lunch, or dinner. Pairs well with a wedge of lemon or lime for extra freshness. Can be served with chili garlic sauce or sriracha for those who prefer extra heat. Also makes a great packed lunch.
